messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
There's been a gunshot at the Cobb Theater, Movie Theater at Cobb and Wesley Chapel.
Okay, can you tell me more about what's happening?
There was a gunshot. Someone has been shot. It looks like it might have been a pistol.
How old is the person who was shot?
I don't know, maybe late 20s.
Is the person male or female?
Male.
Do you know who shot him?
It looks like an older gentleman in the movie theater.
Is the suspect still in the theater?
Yes, he is.
Alright, stay on the line while I connect you to the sheriff's office.
Okay.
Someone is doing chest compressions trying to find a pulse.
Are you with the patient right now?
Yes, we are trying to help him breathe.
Can you check the patient's pulse?
Okay, we are trying.
Where inside the movie theater are you located?
Theater 10.
Okay, help is on the way. There should be someone waiting at the back entrance.
Okay, we will open the door for the ambulance.
Can you tell me where the shooter is sitting?
He is right behind me.
Is the shooter still holding the gun?
Yes.
Can you give me a description of the shooter? Age, clothing?
He looks like he is in his 50s, wearing a light blue shirt.
Is the shooter sitting or standing?
Sitting.
Is he alone?
No, there is someone with him.
I'm a nurse. The pulse is weak. We need the ambulance quickly.
Help is on the way. Stay on the line.
When the deputies arrive, point out the shooter discreetly. Can you do that?
Yes, I can.
Good. Notify me when the deputies are inside.
The pulse is very weak. Please hurry.
Stay on the line. Help is coming.
I can't feel the pulse anymore.
Keep trying. The paramedics will be there any moment.
The deputies are here.
Okay. I'll let you go now. Good job staying calm.
Thank you.
